DOC.brief_summary: To study the effect on decreasing chemotherapeutic toxicity and increasing anti-tumor treatment of Chinese Herbs based on syndrome differentiation
DOC.brief_title: The Effect on Decreasing Chemotherapeutic Toxicity and Increasing Anti-tumor Effect of Chinese Herbs Based on Syndrome Differentiation
DOC.criteria: Histology and cytology diagnosed IIIB or IV nonsmallcell lung cancer (NSCLC) and untreated; Age > 18 ages Sex unlimited; ECOG (Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group) fitness score (Performance status, PS)≤2. White blood cell count ≥ 3 x 10E9 / L, neutrophils ≥1 x 109 p/L, hemoglobin≥80 g/L , platelet ≥100 x 10E9 / L ALT, AST, normal or less than 2 times, bilirubin is normal Serum level in the normal range;Thr ecg is normal Expected survival time≥ 3 months or more; Agreed to the treatment combined traditional Chinese medicine with western medicine Engaged in other clinical subjects Pregnant or lactating women, women in childbearing age refuse contraceptives during the trail Severe pneumonia, tuberculosis, lung abscess, myocarditis and other malignant tumor Severe damage of heart, liver and kidney (cardiac function grade 3 ~ 4, ALT and/or AST 2 times more than normal , Cr more the normal limit) Mental illness, Refused to partner; Cannot obtain informed consent
